page.title: 05TOURISM 3
page.content: Looking along Atholl road ,the main shopping street in Pitlochry ,it would be difficult to miss the concentration of shops dealing in knick-knacks, souvenirs and genuine Scottish gifts.All very well for the tourists but a bit repetitive even for them. Coming a close second are the number of woollen shops - a man from Mars might think the locals eat wool since there are more of them by far than grocers or food shops .There are no authentic super markets , though there is a delicatessan. For young people there is nothing ! Other plans to provide a Chinese carry out or a proper supermarket have so far been squashed -Pitlochry's image must be kept up .Back to the tourists: a comon response when questioned, "Gee, what a cute little old town ."
